Description: Learn how to use AutoGen to build multi-agent systems with diverse roles and capabilities for implementing complex AI applications.
Implement agentic design patterns: Reflection, Tool use, Planning, and Multi-agent collaboration using AutoGen.
Learn directly from the creators of AutoGen, Chi Wang and Qingyun Wu.
Use the AutoGen framework with any model via API call or locally within your own environment.
Implement the tool use design pattern to create a conversational chess game where two agent players can call a tool and make legal moves on the chessboard.
Create a coding agent capable of generating the necessary code to plot stock gains for financial analysis.
Implement multi-agent systems in your workflows.
Build and customize multi-agent systems, enabling agents to take on different roles and collaborate to accomplish complex tasks using AutoGen.
Develop a system where reviewer agents, nested within a critic agent, reflect on the blog post written by another agent.
